tool.name: mOTUs_profile
tool.description: Perform taxonomic profiling (map_tax + calc_mgc + calc_motu) in a single step
tool.command:
#if $db_select.db_source == 'cached' #set $DATABASE_DIR=$db_select.db_cached.fields.path #else #set $database_path = $db_select.database mkdir database_dir && tar -zxvf '$database_path' -C database_dir/ && #set $DATABASE_DIR = 'database_dir' #end if echo "Running motus profile command with database directory: \$DATABASE_DIR" &&
motus profile -t \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-8} -db '${DATABASE_DIR}' -f '${forward_reads}' -r '${reverse_reads}'
#if $unpaired_reads -s '${unpaired_reads}' #end if #if $SAM_BAM_input -i '${SAM_BAM_input}' #end if #if $mgc_read_count -m '${mgc_read_count}' #end if -n '${sample_name}'
#if $additional_options.advanced == "advanced" #if $additional_options.ref_motus_only -e #end if #if $additional_options.full_species_name -u #end if #if $additional_options.result_as_counts -c #end if #if $additional_options.ncbi_tax_ids -p #end if #if $additional_options.biom_format -B #end if #if $additional_options.cami_format -C $additional_options.cami_format #end if #if $additional_options.full_rank_taxonomy -q #end if #if $additional_options.taxonomic_level -k $additional_options.taxonomic_level #end if #end if

param.name: db_source
param.label: Choose the source of the mOTUs database:

param.name: db_cached
param.label: Choose a pre-installed mOTUs database
param.help: We are currently working on integrating the Data Manager for mOTUs. Once integrated, you will be able to select the mOTUs database directly from the cache. In the meantime, no pre-installed mOTUs databases are available.

param.name: database
param.label: Database File
param.help: Please upload your database file in .tar.gz format. If you don't have a custom database, you can download the official mOTUs database from the provided link: https://zenodo.org/records/5140350

param.name: forward_reads
param.label: Forward reads
param.help: (-f) Input file(s) for reads in forward orientation, fastq(.gz)-formatted

param.name: reverse_reads
param.label: Reverse reads
param.help: (-r) Input file(s) for reads in reverse orientation, fastq(.gz)-formatted

param.name: unpaired_reads
param.label: Unpaired reads
param.help: (-s) Input file(s) for unpaired reads, fastq(.gz)-formatted

param.name: ref_motus_only
param.label: Only species with reference genomes
param.help: (-e) Only include species with reference genomes (ref-mOTUs).

param.name: full_species_name
param.label: Print full name of the species
param.help: (-u) Print the full name of the species.

param.name: result_as_counts
param.label: Print results as counts
param.help: (-c) Print result as counts instead of relative abundances.

param.name: cami_format
param.label: Print result in CAMI format
param.help: (-C) Print result in CAMI format (BioBoxes format 0.9.1).

tool.help:
motus profile [options]
Input options: -f FILE[,FILE] input file(s) for reads in forward orientation, fastq(.gz)-formatted -r FILE[,FILE] input file(s) for reads in reverse orientation, fastq(.gz)-formatted -s FILE[,FILE] input file(s) for unpaired reads, fastq(.gz)-formatted -n STR sample name ['unnamed sample'] -i FILE[,FILE] provide SAM or BAM input file(s) (generated by motus map_tax) -m FILE provide a mgc reads count file (generated by motus calc_mgc)
Output options: -o FILE output file name [stdout] -I FILE save the result of BWA in BAM format (output of motus map_tax) -M FILE save the mgc reads count (output of motus calc_mgc) -e only species with reference genomes (ref-mOTUs) -u print the full name of the species -c print result as counts instead of relative abundances -p print NCBI taxonomy identifiers -B print result in BIOM format -C STR print result in CAMI format (BioBoxes format 0.9.1) Values: [precision, recall, parenthesis] -q print the full rank taxonomy -A print all taxonomic levels together (kingdom to mOTUs, override -k) -k STR taxonomic level [mOTU] Values: [kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, mOTU]
Algorithm options: -g INT number of marker genes cutoff: 1=higher recall, 6=higher precision [3] -l INT min length of the alignment (bp) [75] -t INT number of threads [1] -v INT verbosity level: 1=error, 2=warning, 3=message, 4+=debugging [3] -y STR type of read counts [insert.scaled_counts] Values: [base.coverage, insert.raw_counts, insert.scaled_counts]
